channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report E-2024050724
item.description:
Report E-2024050724

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-29
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDE experienced a UN1992 Lacquer Thinner release from (2) 5-gallon metal pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor due to an overtightened bung cap causing the gasket to warp, and release. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged pails and impacted absorbents were then collected into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024051411
item.description:
Report X-2024051411

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: LIVONIA
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: CALEED TO HAZMAT AUDITOR HOLDING AREA FOR POSSIBLE UNDECLARED PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION DISCOVERED A NITROUS OXIDE CYLINDER WITH DOT LABEL 2.2,5.1 INSIDE A PLAIN UNMARKED PACKAGE WITH ONLY FRAGILE HANDLE WITH CARE ON THE OUTER CARTON OTHER THAN THE TRACKING LABEL. PACKAGE IS BEING HELD IN THE AUDITOR HOLDING AREA FOR REGULATORY INSPECTION. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS: 1ZGA09690335516488, 1ZGA09690337436703, 1ZGA09690339222261, 1ZGA09690312563149, 1ZGA09690305083958, 1ZGA09690336146171, 1ZGA09690330934160, 1ZGA09690326306310, 1ZGA09690327414326, 1ZGA09690326389393, 1ZGA09690328828682, 1ZGA09690310181681, 1ZGA09690330249348, 1ZGA09690339269293, 1ZGA09690329320558, 1ZGA09690337110126, 1ZGA09690304171720, 1ZGA09690302424826, 1ZGA09690324056737, 1ZGA09690326652580, 1ZGA09690338098210, 1ZGA09690310069115, 1ZGA09690327132603, 1ZGA09690333928751, 1ZGA09690307976169, 1ZGA09690307978783, 1ZGA09690310258625, 1ZGA09690320360638, 1ZGA09690339542228, 1ZGA09690339298270, 1ZGA09690301755775, 1ZGA09690312010638, 1ZGA0969031006

THE OUTER CARTON HAD NO HAZARD INDICATIONS OR WARNINGS. PACKAGE IS BEING HELD FOR REGULATORY INSPECTION. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS: 1Z2451R80363001518 AND 1Z2451R80328285485.

  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (1) 500 ML BOTTLE OF FLAMMABLE GYEON Q2M TAR SLIGHTLY LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THERMAL TRACKING LABEL DESCRIBES THE CONTENTS AS CLEANING AGENT. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 06521W, AMAZON.COM.KYDC, INC., 125 BUSINESS BLVD, CLEAR BROOK VA 22624-1568.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 1-pound of Azodicarbonamide was released from one 52-pound fiber box due to damage at the corner of the container, likely damaged during loading. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will sweep up the spilled contents and place them into a 20-gallon poly drum for disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PVS Transportation driver was scheduled to deliver a shipment of Ferric Chloride to EQ Detroit. The driver arrived on site and was asked to deliver into tank#2 on site. During the offload the gauging system wasn't functioning properly which resulted in approximately 10 gallons of Ferric Chloride to be released on site in containment. C

item.title: Report E-2024050617
item.description:
Report E-2024050617

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-29T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-18
  • City: MARSHALL
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SET Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-1ft area of the trailer floor, 20ft-by-8ft area of the asphalt lot and estimated that twelve (12) gallons of material was released due to a puncture in one (1) 220-gallon poly tote. SET Environmental personnel deployed a neutralizer and then granular absorbents to the impacted area. The spent material was gathered and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged tote was cut-up and placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
